document_title: Psoriatic arthritis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Psoriatic arthritis is one of the autoimmune arthritis diseases, which occurs when the body's immune system mistakenly attacks healthy tissues and cells inside the body. It is these abnormal reactions of the immune system that cause inflammation in the joints, as well as the overproduction of cells in the skin.
It is currently unclear why the immune system attacks healthy tissues and cells, but a number of factors are believed to be the cause of the disease including:
Genetic factors: Statistics show that many patients have a family history of either psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis. Studies also demonstrate that genetic factors are related to the disease.; Environmental factors: Patients can be exposed to chemicals, radioactive substances, bacterial and viral infections...
